meanings.definition: To strip (something) of its covering or surface layer.
meanings.sent1: The strong wind denudated the tree of its leaves.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers denudated the old building to renovate it.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel denudated the garden of all its flowers for a playful prank.
meanings.sent4: The artist denudated the canvas, revealing a masterpiece beneath the layers of paint.
meanings.sent5: The river denudated the riverbank, exposing the rocks underneath.

meanings.definition: To make bare or expose by removing covering or surface layers.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologists carefully denudated the ancient artifact to reveal its intricate details.
meanings.sent2: The erosion denudated the hillside, revealing layers of sediment.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon denudated the picnic basket of all its goodies.
meanings.sent4: The storm denudated the landscape, leaving it barren and exposed.
meanings.sent5: The artist denudated the sculpture, showcasing the raw beauty of the material.
